She lifted her bare foot above his head. Link didn’t move. Every fiber of his being told him to run for his life, but he couldn’t move at all. It was like someone was forcing him to stand and face this head on.

“Saria, you have no idea what you’re dealing with,” Link said. When it was over, Link’s eyes opened. Had he just said that? She’s holding her foot over his body preparing to crush him and he’s saying that she has no idea what she’s up against? Link then realized that the voice that said that was not his. It was deeper and more grown up. How did he say that? Link only looked up in enough time to see the sole of Saria’s foot coming down on him.

In a moment Link’s body was unloaded with searing pain. His body was forced to the ground. He lay on his back with the immense pressure of Saria’s foot bearing down on his chest, forcing him into the wooden floor. His head was nestled between her big and second toe. He clenched his teeth in pain. But he would not scream, he knew that no matter what happened, something did not want him to give into her.

Saria’s toes parted, releasing his face. She looked at him and said, “Well?”
He just glared back at her. “It seems you haven’t had enough yet. I’ll break this defiance.” She then began rubbing her foot back and forth, dragging Link across the floor. The scraping pain across the floor was excruciating, but Link didn’t give in. He didn’t beg for her to stop, he didn’t make a sound. “Defiant to the end, eh?” she asked. “Link, you just don’t seem to get it. This is your life now! You belong to me! You live to serve my feet!!! If you don’t obey, then this will be the end.”

Link didn’t submit. What was scary is was that he actually believed her. He believed that his best friend wouldn’t hesitate to crush him to death. But he wouldn’t give in. His will would not be broken. Something told him not to. Something in Link’s gut told him that someone was watching over him…

…Little did he know…someone was.

--
The Center of the Megaverse
--

“YOU CAN’T LET THIS GO ON!!!” Link shouted to the others. “How can you let him go through this? He is our brother! He’s one of us!!!” Link began pacing around the center of the counsel room where he stood, as he looked back and forth from the three thrones that surrounded it. “You are the Primes, you have to do something!”

“Linkzilla, silence yourself,” another Link said. This Link sat in one of the three thrones. He looked exactly like the Link from before. The two of them together looked like the older versions of the Child Link that Saria was torturing. They wore exactly the same outfit; the difference being the tunic worn by the Link in the center had a worn patch over his right side. “This is where he is supposed to be. This is his destiny, and I will not have you altering his pre-chosen destiny as the way you did yours!!!” the Link on the throne said as he slammed his gauntleted fist down on the armrest.

“What Ocarina Prime means to say,” one of the other Links from the second throne said. This Link was Twilight Princess Link. “Is that whatever is happening to the boy is meant to happen. You know the way things work brother; in each of our three Multiverses, there are millions of Universes. Each of those Universes has to have different history from our Prime Universes. The Link you care for just happens to be from the ‘Shrinking Universe’. You don’t need to worry though, he isn’t going to die.”

“No?” the first Link said. “And without my help, Saria will break his will and force him to be her Foot Slave for the rest of his life?! And then she’ll get Malon and Zelda involved and they’ll treat him like he’s not even a person anymore! It’s a fate worse than death! I can’t take that sitting down!”

“Well you don’t need to concern yourself,” a fourth Link from the final throne said. This Link was tiny, light green tunic, a large head and large eyes. It was the Wind Waker Link. “Like Twilight Prime says, this is just one tiny Link in one tiny timeline in one tiny alternate Universe. Don’t concern yourself with him. Just get back to your own Universe with the knowledge that there are several other Links in your Multiverse that are happy.”

“But that’s the trouble Wind Waker Prime!” the Link in the center said. He moved toward Waker Prime’s Throne and said, “I can’t get over it. Regardless of Universe or Timeline, we are all the same Link. They are all Me! So why should this boy be forced to be miserable?! It’s not fair?! He deserves the same amount of happiness that every other Link gets!”

Ocarina Prime began pinching his sinuses and said, “Do we need to remind you that they also have one Universe where a Link is shrunken? They know of this problem. We don’t know who dictates why this must happen but it does. There’s nothing we can do.”

“No,” Link said as he began pacing toward Ocarina Prime’s Throne. “There is much you can do about it…You just choose not to! You, you three are the most powerful Links there are in the three Multiverses. Yet you sit here in the center of the Megaverse discussing what is to be done. No, you don’t discuss, you just bitch about what is to be done and you don’t do anything! You need to take action! Why would you let this happen?!”

“Linkzilla,” Ocarina Link Prime said standing up and descending the three steps from his throne to the center where the first Link stood. “I know this upsets you…Brother. It upsets me too. It’s not fair.” He had now stood about a foot from Link. “But we will not alter the course of another Timeline and create another Universe! It could have damaging consequences. It’s only a stroke of luck that your new Universe survived.”

“I had to do it,” Linkzilla said as he stared into OoT Link Prime’s eyes. “Imagine what you would do if you were in that position?!”

“You forget brother…I was in that position,” he said. “You are me.”

“Then why don’t you care? You seemed to stop caring after you defeated Ganondorf. Then you came here to dictate everything that goes on in that Multiverse while the other Links branched out into their own Universes. Though we are all essentially the same person, we are all very different. It wasn’t you who competed in the Smash Tournament and defeated Master Hand; it was me. And when Master Hand returned for his revenge; it was me he came after! And when I had defeated him a second time I was the one who was infected with Necro’lyte Death! Then just when I think my life couldn’t get any worse, my timeline branches off into the GIANTESS Universe?!!! It’s not fair! Everything that happened to me has utterly destroyed me. If something’s not done, it could happen to that Boy as well…And sitting here discussing it; THAT’S NOT GOOD ENOUGH!!!”

“Linkzilla…we are in charge for a reason. There is a natural order of things. And we are not going to let you disturb it twice. Not ever again.” Ocarina Prime put his hand on Linkzilla’s shoulder and turned him to the side. “I am not in the mood to deal with your rash actions. I won’t let your personal Vendetta against the Princess spread to the other Links…This Rebellious attitude of yours is becoming quite alarming…and we will not tolerate it anymore. Now get yourself back to the Countdown Universe and stop wasting our time…”

Linkzilla being the first Link’s name looked at him with fire burning in his eyes. He knew that the Primes were tired of him interfering with their affairs. He also knew that he was infinitely more powerful than they’d ever be. All because he did something different; he did what he wasn’t supposed to and deviated away from his destiny. He didn’t play by the rules any longer…and now he was the most powerful being they’d seen since the Definitive Link went into hiding. He looked around at the other two Primes before returning attention to Ocarina Prime. He sneered at him and said, “…
1111221111.title: Unexpected Twist

11112211111.content:
“If you won’t do anything, I WILL!!!” Linkzilla yelled. Suddenly a green orb appeared above Linkzilla’s head. He reached up and clasped the orb in his hands. Ocarina Prime tried to grab him. Unfortunately a gust of wind shot out from the orb once it was touched. Linkzilla vanished.

“Damn that Reckless Fool!!!” Ocarina Prime yelled. He turned to the other two Primes and asked, “Why didn’t any of you tell me that he had a Faerore’s Wind Teleport Marker in that Dimension?!”

“Hey Brother,” Twilight Prime Started. “It’s your spell he’s using.”

“Yeah,” Waker Prime added. “We haven’t used that ability in over a hundred years.”

“Well REGARDLESS!!!” Ocarina Prime said. “We have to stop him!!!”

--
Ocarina of Time Multiverse
--

Faerore’s Wind is sending Linkzilla to the Universe where Child Link is being tortured.
“Hold on Little Brother,” he said. “Help is on the way.”

The Primes were following him as he ripped through the dimensions. Pretty soon he was the ‘Shrinking Universe’ of the Ocarina of Time Multiverse. He could see the blue planet of Nintendo coming into view. Just as he was about to enter the planet’s atmosphere, he vanished.

The Primes were right behind him and were about to enter the planet to stop him. Ocarina Prime was leading the way when suddenly the three of them stopped. A force field bounced them back.

“Radioactivity!” Ocarina Prime said. “That bastard is trying to keep us out!”

“Well he’s succeeding,” Waker Prime said. “If we go in there, we’re dead!”

“Well then what do you suggest?” Ocarina Prime said.

“Nothing,” Twilight Prime said. The others looked at him. Ocarina Prime looked wildly mad in his eyes. “I say, we enjoy ourselves. It’s not everyday that the unexpected happens, I suggest we watch the show and see how it plays out. It could prove to be very entertaining…”

Ocarina Prime looked at his Brother Prime. He looked back at the planet. “I can’t stand seeing the land of Hyrule destroyed…especially by any Link. Plus, that bastard has only one thing on his mind when it comes to the Princess. So if any harm comes to her, we rush in Swords a Blazing.”

--
Saria’s House
--

Saria could barely contain herself. Having Link under her foot, so helpless and powerless was so invigorating. She felt so empowered keeping Link trapped under her foot. She was enjoying this dearly. She knew that even though Link had fought many monsters, he wasn’t strong enough to resist this. She knew that with a little more pressure he’d give in. Right now she was being gentle, but if he didn’t give up soon, she’d apply more pressure and break his will. But not enough to break him. She knew he’d give up eventually. The look on his face showed clear pain. He was on the verge of begging for release from this pain.

But then suddenly, she felt the bottom of her foot become warmer. She felt Link’s body warming up to the point where her foot was stinging with the heat. Then she saw Link’s eyes shoot open. His eyes were completely glowing green. No pupils, no irises, no corneas, just two green lights and they burned with a fiery rage. Saria had no idea what was happening or why. She was about to take her foot away from him when she felt it moving by itself. Her foot was lifting itself off the ground. What was going on? She looked at the ground and saw that Link was still was still lying on his back. The difference was, Link was growing! He was almost full size again!

She didn’t know what magic caused him to shrink but apparently it was wearing off. But then why were his eyes glowing? Saria then noticed more changes about his feature. His teeth had grown sharp and he was making growling animal sounds. Then Saria noticed that even though Link had grown back to his full size, he was still growing! Pretty soon his chest was larger than Saria’s full body. With him ever expanding, eventually Saria’s foot had been lifted too high and she fell over. When she fell over on her ass, she saw Link continue to transform. He was nearly ten feet tall when he suddenly turned over on his stomach. She heard his bones cracking. She saw his vertebrae growing under his skin. It seemed like his entire skeletal frame was being reinforced as he grew. He was thrashing about like a wild animal. She wondered how it was possible that his tunic had remained in tact. But then again, the magic that shrunk him also shrunk his clothes, so she figured that growing them wasn’t too farfetched.

Link had pulled himself onto one knee and stood up looking around the house. By the time his head had touched the ceiling, he was looking down at Saria at a startling twenty foot height. He looked quite angry with her. Before this behemoth, Saria could only do one thing.

--

The Kokiri had heard Saria cry out in terror when they saw her running from her house. They wondered what had spooked her so badly. She turned back to look at her house in pure terror. That’s when everyone saw it. The wooden roof of her house was bulging outwards. Something big inside the house, trying to break free. From the open door, they heard the low growl of a monstrous beast; it sounded like a Dodongo…only bigger. Before long, the Kokiri saw the roof of Saria’s house break free to reveal a Thirty Foot Link with glowing green eyes. He roared in triumph having broken free. He then looked down at the crowd and roared at them as well.

“RUN!!!” Saria shouted as she brought herself to her feet. The Kokiri followed suit as they chased after her. Link brought a gigantic foot up over the edge of the hole in Saria’s roof. He stepped out completely over Saria’s house. When he has completely broke free, the onlookers could see that Link was nearly fifty feet tall!!!

--

Standing from a perfect vantage point on the dead Deku Tree, looking on the chaos going on about the forest was Linkzilla. He watched the panic with a smile on his face. A devious yet justified smile.

“Let the games begin,” he said.
11112211111.title: "If you won't do anything, I WILL!!!"

111122111111.content:
All Hell was breaking loose around her. Saria watched as the Kokiri ran in fear from Link. This was incredible - one moment she had Link completely at her mercy, and now...this! Link was knocking trees over, stomping about, roaring and terrorizing everything that ran away in fear. There were few places that they could go for refuge. They couldn't leave the forest or they'd die. And going into the Lost Woods would result in them becoming Skull Kids.

At this point, there was one, rather desperate solution - they could all take Refuge inside the husk of the Great Deku Tree. It was large enough to house all of them...But it was still a bit of a long shot. Saria just saw Link flatten the home of the "Know-it-All" Brothers. With his new strength - he could easily uproot the Deku Tree. And even more shockingly - he looked to be getting even taller. He had to have at the very least doubled in size by now. She could only hope that if any of his old self was in there, that he'd think twice before destroying the Deku Tree.

As Saria ran for the entrance to the Shrine, leading as many Kokiri as she could - she could somehow sense that all of this was her fault. It somehow was karma coming back to get her for what she tried to do to Link. But she never expected him to suddenly turn into a giant Monster! And now, she could only watch Helplessly as Link destroyed his home. She felt so bad for what was happening; what happened to Link? Why had he shrunk? Why had he grown? What was the cause of all this?!

"Why is this Happening?!" she yelled, finally breaking down, nearing tears.

"You know very well why this is happening," she heard a deep voice say. She turned saw a figure standing there. He wore a battered and slightly burned green tunic, much like what the Kokiri wore. He had scars on his face and looked at her very sternly. Something about this person was familiar to Saria as she looked past his golden blonde hair, into his deep blue eyes. She finally saw it - he looked like Link. Only...this Link was a Man.

He took a step towards her, saying, "You know very well what you did...what you wanted to do, what you tried to do."

She got very frightened when he stepped towards her - it wasn't just his size; something else about this man made him far more imposing than anything she had seen in this world...She was more frightened of him than the 100 foot Link destroying the Forest. She slowly began to back away as he advanced. But when she did, his pace suddenly quickened.

"Who - Who are you?!" she asked, stuttering. He was immediately on her, and she soon found her throat locked inside his large hand. She was lifted off the ground.

"How can you look into my eyes and ask me that?!" he snarled at her. "You know very well who I am!" He wasn't fully strangling her - but it was hard for her to breathe in this position. "You...you were once his best friend," he continued. "And yet you treated him like nothing but an insole! I barely know who you are anymore - so I wouldn't expect you to know me. I am the one who delivers TRUE justice to the lives of One who deserves it. And I am here because of what you did to him - for Shrinking him and treating him so shamefully!"

"Gah - I," she managed to say. "I...didn't shrink him."

He gave her a quick jolt and yelled, "Don't you Dare lie to me!"

"I'm not lying - Honest!" she managed to wheeze. "I swear."

"Maybe you are...and maybe you're not," he said. "But regardless...the way you treated your friend...someone you loved dearly! - as little more than a plaything. You tried to take away his humanity! His Dignity! His power! But I came to restore that power - and to reveal one that he didn't even know he had. So you ask me...who am I?" He pulled her close to his face and looked into her eyes - she could see into his; they were cold and dark...this man was filled with nothing but hatred. "I am His Revenge!"

She suddenly felt him grip her neck tightly. All air left her - she began to writhe, trying desperately to free herself from his grip. She couldn't draw in breath. She was panicking, even though she knew she could do nothing. He was so much stronger than she was...She was doomed.

Suddenly - the two of them felt a gust of wind past by them. The older Link turned to look in the direction of the wind. Both of them were shocked to see Link was hunched over, glaring at them - the gust of wind was his breath panting towards them. He looked at the Older Link very angrily. He roared at him. Linkzilla raised an eyebrow at his younger counterpart.

"You want me to..."
111122111111.title: The Revenge

111122111112.content:
In Link's Mind, Link was having the Fight of his Life with nothing but his Kokiri Sword, against a person who said he was him from another universe, for the Mind and Soul. "Stop Resisting!" Linkzilla yelled, tossing Link aside using the Master Sword of his Dimension. "I won't let you hurt anyone in Kokiri Forest!" Link said, Kokiri Sword in hand.

Link was once again tossed aside by Linkzilla. Linkzilla put his foot on Link's Chest. "Isn't this what that Forest Girl Saria did to you?!" Linkzilla yelled, pressing his foot down. "Yes. But I don't hold her for it!" Link said.
=============
"Brother!" Ocarina Prime said. "Take my Power!" he sent all the power he had to Link, to make him stronger for the battle.
=============
Link felt a Power surge through him, he magically turned into Adult Link, and tossed Linkzilla aside. Link quickly ran over to the Movement Generator. "Damn, This Linkzilla has turned my body into a Living Machine!" Link yelled. He drew the Master Sword of his dimension, and stabbed the Generator. The 30 Foot Link, raised a foot unintentionally, and slammed it on 3 Male Kokiri Children, crushing their bones and skulls.

"Damn, I'm sorry Kokiri Forest Inhabitants." Link muttered. Linkzilla got back up, and with blood dripping from Several Cuts on his body, tried to take re-control of this Monstrous Link. Is He successful?
111122111112.title: A Fight for the Mind and Body

11112212.content: "I thought I told you to stop moving," Saria said in an angry voice as she pulled Link out. Just for that, I will make you ...
11112212.title: Another Punishment

111122121.content:
"I thought I told you to stop moving," Saria said in an angry voice as she pulled Link out. "Just for that, I will make you lick my feet clean!!!"

Link's eyebrows raised and a look of confused horror was covering him, "Saria, you can't possibly expect me to do this willingly."

Saria, with link in hand, flicked him ever so gently in his stomach, this tiniest movement knocked the breath right out of him, with this she gave him a cute innocent smile. "Linky, you're nothing right now, if you try my patients I may just have remove your "Master Sword" and believe me, I will enjoy that." Saria's innoncent smile faded to a much more sinister grin, "Now get lickin'."

As Saria placed link down on the ground she leaned against a tree with a casual look, a look that made Link realize that this torture was nothing, that Saria had much bigger things in mind. Link dutifully began licking the bottom of her feet which she proudly presented, they were covered in dirt, it was more disgusting than anything he had ever had to seen. Saria enjoyed the power she felt, she longed to be with Link for so long, and now she realized that he would never be hers in love, and she giggled since now he was simply hers.

After cleaning both of them to the extent that Saria deemed "adequate" she picked him up and put him back in her shoes, this time Link seemed more accepting of being in here, for now there wasn't a thing he could do about it.

Saria had intended to take Link to her house, but she wasn't sure about it, she had her own little toy and she wasn't content with sharing, at least not with just anyone, she wanted to find someone who was willing to share her toy...
111122121.title: Link's Master Sword

choices: Saria befriends Malon and shares Link.
Saria uses Link to control Malon.
1111221211.content:
Saria, a long with a hidden agenda was filled with a desire to make Link feel pain, but not simple suffering, no she wanted him to be humiliated. Saria began devising a plan. She knew the most humiliating thing for him would be for him to kiss her feet in the presence of that Princess of Hyrule. however it was too soon, Saria wanted to have some fun, and she couldn't risk link's disobedience.

Saria carried Link in her shoe, where he did not dare move. Saria thought long and hard as she walked across Hyrule field, she saw a farm, a farm or magnificent proportions. She had a thought, she remembered hearing of the farmgirl whom link was mildly fond of. According to Link she was obsessed with getting Link to stay with her. Saria would use this desire and further her purposes.
1111221211.title: Saria heads out on the road.

choices: Malon is outraged by Link's stature
Malon is happy to have a new 'doggie'.
11112212111.content:
Saria stroleed throught the front gates of this farm, it was quaint, but at the same time beautiful. It was serene and peaceful, she continued forward and suddenly covered her eyes. She saw something she didn't want, an older gentleman with a strange mustache was mumbling to himself while working nude. "That little bitch thinks I'll take this forever. I'll show her."

Saria backed up for a minute and bumped into a door. She fell through the door and into the stables flat on her precious behind.

"Who?" Began a voice from per red lips. "What are you doing here? Who are you?"
"I" began Saria "am the answer to your prayers."
The red headed angel cocked an eyebrow. "Nice introduction, you can call me Malon."
Saria nodded. "And I am SariaWho was that old man mumbling to himself out there? And why the hell is he naked?"
"That scab is called Ingo, he attempted to takeover the farm and was successful, until Link helped me, and I regained control." Malon said with a cheery smile.
"I see, but why is he naked." Saria chuckled.
"As penance, I gave him a choice of being brought up on charges and beheaded, or serving here." Malon laughed out loud.
Saria laughed nearly as hardily. "Well, it serves him right I say, when a man wrongs you he should pay."
Malon chuckled again. "That's the only pay around here, any wages he 'legally makes' is put into my account in the castle." Malon then stopped herself. "Anyway, enough about my little doggie. Why are you here Saria? 'The answere to my prayers is very inspecific."
"I have a new 'doggie' for you." Saria smiled. "Remember that Link fellow? Do you love him? do you want him around forever"
"Yes" She responded.

Saria removed her shoe and link feel down to the ground between Malon's feet.
11112212111.title: Saria befriends Malon.

choices: tightens the strings over her chest
111122121111.content:
Malon gasped at the sight of Link, lying on the ground, encrusted in sweat and twitching. She picked him up and dropped the hero into her cleavage. "How dare you do this to him?" She yelled in Saria's face. Before the girl could answer, Malon's hand had swiftly slapped her across the face. The door to the house then slammed and a lock clicked.

"Unh..." Link groaned, starting to awaken from his unconsiousness. He heard a loud giggle above his head and blinked his eyes open. He saw the massive face of Malon above him. It was then that he realized where he was lying. Link blushed as he looked at the two mounds of flesh on either side of him.
Malon...
111122121111.title: Anger

choices: Link and Saria somehow making breakfast (WTF)
1111221211111.content:
Link was removed from Malon's cleavage, and was set on her desk. "You okay Fairy Boy?" She asked with a calm smile. "2 Comments: Thank you for saving me from that witch Saria, and PLEASE STOP CALLING ME 'FAIRY BOY'!" Link shouted. "Alright, no need to get angry Link." Malon answered with a chuckle. "Would you like to go for a ride on Epona?" "Yeah, but Saria took the Ocarina when she punished me, she's probably crushed it by now." Link said.

A Few Hours later after Link told his story to Malon....

A Knock on the door was visibly heard from outside, Link was carried over to Malon's window, and looked outside to see Saria. Link looked at her with a deathly glare, while Saria, looked down in sadness.

Malon glared at Saria, but let her in. "Link, I'm sorry for torturing you, and for threatening to rip off your 'Master Sword'." Saria said. "Do you mean the actual sword on his back?" Malon asked. Saria looked at her with a glimpse, and a cheek raised. Malon burst out laughing. "Link, I'm going to apologize by doing this." Saria said. She played a mysterious song, she had found in the Forest Temple, and was instantly shrunk down to Link's size, well half his size, because he was an adult, and she was a child.

Saria ran up to Link, and hugged him tightly. "I'm so sorry Link!" Saria said. She cried onto Link's tunic for around 30 minutes, until he had to switch into his Goron Tunic, so the Tears and Snot would just evaporate. "Saria. I forgive you. Now, change yourself back." Link said. "It's irreversible. I figured if one was going to stay shrunken forever, it would be me." Saria said.

"Why would you take such a risk?" Malon and Link asked. "Because, Link...I...I love you!" Saria screamed crying. "Saria, if you loved me, then why would you torture me when You had me?" Link asked. "I..I..I was heart-broken that You had tossed my Ocarina away!" Saria said. "Well, maybe I did, maybe I didn't." Link said pulling the wooden Ocarina out from his Adventure Bag.

"You...You saved it?" Saria said with tears in her eyes. "If you had let me finish when I was trying to tell you, You would've learned that I saved it." Link said. "I'M SORRY LINK!" Saria yelled digging her face into Link's tunic again.

Hours Later...(Saria and Malon wanted to know what had happened before taking Gannondorf down)

"I guess it's time for bed, where do you guys want to sleep?" Malon asked. "I think it would be safest to put us in a bottle for now. We need a little more time to work things out." Link said. Saria agreed, and in a minute, they were gently scooped up, and gently put in a bottle. It took a few more hours, but Link and Saria had finally worked everything out.

Where does Malon find the 2 when she wakes up?
1111221211111.title: Malon; Peaceful Giantess

11112212111111.content:
Malon woke up, and went to check her 2 friends, which she had left in a bottle, and saw that Link was sleeping, with Saria laying her head on his lap, Link also had his hand, gently rested upon Saria's Head, and they were both sound asleep. "That's adorable." Malon said. She then began to make some breakfast, basically just eggs from the Cuccos, and Bacon.

Link woke up, before Saria nonetheless, because she was were she wanted to be, with Link. "Saria, wake up." Link said gently shaking the young Kokiri's head. "Huh? Link. Where are we?" Saria asked a little groggy from her sleep. "I see you 2 are awake." Malon said. She handed them each a piece of scrambled egg, and a sliver of bacon, on crafted wooden plates.

"Saria, do..you know the main reason I shrunk?" Link said, since the day before, Saria was able to shrink herself. "I'm sorry Link. I really don't know." Saria said laying on Link's arm. Malon let them free from the bottle, as soon as she and they were done eating. "I think we should go see that princess, what's her name? Zelda?" Malon asked, she had not been to Hyrule for a long time, so she could barely remember the Princess' name.

"Please, take us there immediately." Link said. "There will be no need for me, my shrunken stature is irreversible." Saria said. Link grabbed Saria's shoulders. "There may be a chance." Link said. "It's impossible." Saria said. "Nothing is Impossible, until it is deemed." Malon stated.

Saria gained a vote of confidence, and went along.
11112212111111.title: Sleeping Link, Cuddling Saria

choices: Saria replies: I'm not so sure.
111122121111111.content:
Malon got lucky, because right before she left, The Castle called, saying they needed some Milk, for the Princess' Upcoming Birthday, which Link, Saria, and Malon were invited to. With the Help of her father, the Ranch Manager, Talon, She loaded some Milk from the Cows, into a Wagon, and got Epona, and a Few other Horses, to ride along the way.

Link and Saria, jumped on Epona's Head, and Link put on his Shiekah Mask, and heard the thoughts of Epona. "Master Link? Is that Truly You?" Link heard Epona think. "Yes Epona, it's Me." Link said. "Good, I was tempted to eat you for a moment." Epona thought. Link sighed and walked with Saria on his Shoulder, back to Malon.

The Ride was finally over when the Carriage was let into the Princess' Garden. "Princess Zelda!" Malon said, Link and Saria in hand. Malon explained everything to Princess Zelda, and Zelda tried her Magic Power (as the 7th Sage) on Link and Saria. Link grew a few more inches, until He was 6 inches tall, More than half over Saria's height, in which she did not grow.

"Link's size is reversible, but as Saria said, hers is not." Zelda said. She worked the rest of her Magic, on Link, and grew him back to full height.
